Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric has a partially grey core, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.196)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36479) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36479)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 339 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13525 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
